Context:
Our Centre for Hospitality and Culinary Arts offers leading hospitality and culinary training programs. The programs help students build necessary skill sets for success in this field, whether as enthusiasts or career builders. Courses are taught by expert teachers with a passion for sharing professional knowledge and experience. Classes are interactive and utilize state-of-the-art facilities.

Student Success Stories: Browse a list of stories on the website or visit the Student Success Stories web page for more stories.

Detailed course information, including skills, topics, activities, and menu items can be found on George Brown's college-wide Course Outlines Search webpage. (Content is subject to change.)

The Centre for Hospitality and Culinary Arts hosts innovative events such as book signings with celebrity chefs, trendy dinners prepared by guest chefs, and food/beverage tours. Visit the CHCA event website for details and tickets.

George Brown College is located on the traditional territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and other Indigenous peoples.

Website information is subject to change without notice and should not be considered a representation, offer or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
